title: Differences between Sampling explainer and IME?
body:
Hi,

Thanks for the great library!

I have a question on sampling explainer (`shap/explainers/_sampling.py`): the documentation states that the explainer is an extension of IME. Are the differences between shap's implementation of IME and the original IME noted anywhere? 

I have found a few if-s which are not part of the original algorithm, but I am most interested in knowing whether the [lines 130-135](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/cb73243c98f94fbb77180a719c780156d0bddfbe/shap/explainers/_sampling.py#L130) that deal with optimal allocation of samples according to variance are also different from the original algorithm.

In the original paper, sample allocation is done iteratively, one sample at a time, taking into account the updated estimate of variance. In shap, this is done in advance, using the initial estimate of variance.
Are the two ways equivalent in some way (is there a connection) or is this a different allocation scheme?
